problems.yes: You provided DOCSTRING-GTusername file with full reproducibility ensured.
problems.no: You did not provide DOCSTRING-GTusername file or reproducibility instructions.

problems.yes: You used Overleaf and LaTeX for your report.
problems.no: You did not use Overleaf and LaTeX for your report.

problems.yes: You included a valid GitHub commit hash and it works.
problems.no: You did not include a valid GitHub commit hash.

problems.yes: You provided clear instructions to run your code.
problems.no: You did not provide clear instructions to run your code.

problems.yes: Your report is a PDF file.
problems.no: Your report is not submitted as a PDF.

problems.yes: Your report is 8 pages or less.
problems.no: Your report exceeded 8 pages.

problems.yes: Your graphs and text are legible at 100% zoom.
problems.no: Your graphs or text are not legible at 100% zoom.

problems.yes: You used consistent and proper reference formatting (APA, MLA, or IEEE).
problems.no: You did not maintain consistent reference formatting or lacked external citations.

problems.yes: You stated an explicit hypothesis for what you expect in the report.
problems.no: You did not state an explicit hypothesis.

problems.yes: Your hypothesis is grounded in evidence from lecture, paper, or theory.
problems.no: Your hypothesis lacks grounding in evidence or theory.

problems.yes: You followed up on the hypothesis in the discussion or conclusion.
problems.no: You did not follow up on your hypothesis in the discussion or conclusion.

problems.yes: You provided direct evidence in your results to support or refute your hypothesis.
problems.no: You did not provide direct evidence supporting or refuting your hypothesis.

problems.yes: You clearly described hyperparameter selection (number of clusters) for each dataset.
problems.no: You did not describe how you selected the number of clusters for each dataset.

problems.yes: You provided visualization or demonstration of clustering results.
problems.no: You did not include visualization or demonstration of clustering results.

problems.yes: You provided meaningful analysis of results, describing cluster shape and limitations.
problems.no: You did not provide meaningful analysis or mention limitations of clustering results.

part4.title: Step 2: Dimensionality Reduction for Two Datasets

problems.yes: You clearly described how you chose the number of components for each DR method (PCA, ICA, RP).
problems.no: You did not describe how you chose the number of components for DR methods.

problems.yes: You provided supporting results such as eigenvalues, explained variance, or kurtosis.
problems.no: You did not provide supporting results for DR method selection.

problems.yes: You provided visualizations or demonstrations of DR results.
problems.no: You did not include visualization or demonstration of DR results.

problems.yes: You analyzed transformed features, interpreting component meaning and limitations.
problems.no: You did not analyze or interpret transformed features or mention limitations.

part5.title: Step 3: Dimensionality Reduction, then Clustering for Two Datasets

problems.yes: You provided visual demonstrations of DR+Clustering performance and reselected optimal clusters.
problems.no: You did not provide visual demonstrations or reselect clusters after DR.

problems.yes: You provided comparative analysis between methods (e.g., PCA vs ICA).
problems.no: You did not provide comparative analysis between DR+Clustering methods.

part6.title: Step 4: Dimensionality Reduction on Neural Network (One Dataset)

problems.yes: You reported performance change due to DR with supporting results.
problems.no: You did not report or provide results for DR impact on NN performance.

problems.yes: You analyzed wall clock time or speed change (or equivalent metric).
problems.no: You did not analyze change in wall clock time or speed.

part7.title: Step 5: Clustering on Neural Network (One Dataset)

problems.yes: You reported performance change due to clustering on NN with supporting results.
problems.no: You did not report or provide results for clustering impact on NN performance.

problems.yes: You analyzed wall clock time or speed change (or equivalent metric).
problems.no: You did not analyze change in wall clock time or speed.

problems.yes: You summarized key findings and connected results across datasets and methods.
problems.no: You did not summarize findings or connect results across datasets.

problems.yes: You discussed limitations and proposed future work.
problems.no: You did not discuss limitations or propose future work.

part9.title: Extra Credit: Non-linear Manifold Learning Algorithm

problems.yes: You implemented a Non-linear Manifold Learning Algorithm with visualization and deep insights.
problems.no: You did not provide visualization or deep insights for Non-linear Manifold Learning.

rules.description: If any section contains a list with four or more bullet points, apply a 50-point deduction (single penalty).
